conclusion: Need to understand how position and size of objects change with light source movement.
Objects labeled A, B, C, D positioned above slabs.
A: A pie on a plate.
C: A shadow of the pie.
Pie on a plate is relatively small compared to other objects.
Calendar positioned above pie, casting a shadow.
Light source movement will cause shadows to shift.
Pie’s shadow will move to the right.
Calendar’s shadow will move to the left.
Baseball's shadow will remain in the same position relative to the objects.
Final answer: Pie's shadow moves right, calendar's shadow moves left, baseball's shadow remains same.
